daily_summary.headline: Exciting Aurora and Space Launches Await

top_events.title: Aurora G1 Storm
top_events.description: A G1 geomagnetic storm is expected on February 5th, offering a good chance to view auroras at latitudes as low as 60°.
top_events.action: Plan to observe auroras if you're at a high latitude.

top_events.title: Falcon 9 Block 5 | Crew-12
top_events.description: SpaceX's Crew-12 mission is set to launch soon, continuing the vital crew rotation for the ISS.
top_events.action: Watch the live stream for this important crewed mission.

top_events.title: Long March 2F/G | Chinese Reusable Space Vehicle
top_events.description: China's Long March 2F/G will launch a reusable space vehicle, marking a significant step in reusable space technology.
top_events.action: Follow updates on this innovative mission.

alerts.title: Aurora G1 Storm Alert
alerts.message: A G1 geomagnetic storm is expected on February 5th, with auroras visible down to 60° latitude. This is a great opportunity for aurora enthusiasts.
alerts.action_required: Prepare for aurora viewing if you are at high latitudes and ensure clear skies.

opportunities.recommendation: Good viewing opportunity for high-latitude observers. Worth checking if you're above 60° latitude and skies are clear.
Possible aurora at high latitudes. Best for northern locations (65°+). Worth checking if conditions are optimal.
